This is a tough question, and it's one that every candidate dreads, but you've got to be honest and show that you're not just looking for a job, you're looking for a career. Here's how I'd answer it:

**Be honest, but not too honest**. You don't want to be like, "Oh, I'm so scared I'm gonna get laid off!" But you also don't want to be like, "I'm so confident, I'm gonna be here forever!" You want to show that you're positive, but also that you're realistic.

**Talk about all the things you love about the company**. "I love the mission, I love the people, I love the culture... I love everything about this place!" Make them remember why they hired you in the first place!

**Show them you're a team player**. "I know we're going through tough times, but I'm not just looking out for myself, I'm looking out for everyone! I'm gonna do whatever it takes to help this company succeed!"

**And then, just casually drop it in there...** "But, you know, if this company doesn't make it, I don't know if I even want to be in this industry anymore!" (Just kidding, kind of...). You want to show them that you're so committed, but also that you're not gonna be stuck in a dead-end job forever.

**End it with a positive note**. "I know we can do this, I know we're gonna come out of this stronger than ever! I'm so excited to be a part of this team, to be a part of this journey!" You want to leave them feeling like, "Wow, we're gonna be okay! We're gonna be amazing!"

Tracking our progress is one of the most important things we can do to stay motivated and see how far we've come. Here are some ways to do it:

 **Journaling**: Write down your goals, your dreams, your fears... everything. Write down how you feel, what you're grateful for, what you're proud of. Write down all the little victories, all the tiny wins. It's like a diary, but it's so much more than that. It's your story, your journey, your progress.
 **Make a vision board**: Cut out pictures, words, quotes... everything that inspires you. Put it all on a board and stare at it every day. Remind yourself of what you want, what you're working for.
 **Take progress pics**: I mean, come on! Take a picture of yourself every week, every month... every year! See how far you've come! See how strong you are! See how beautiful you are!
 **Track your numbers**: Whether it's your weight, your runs, your reps... track it all! See how far you've come, how fast you're getting there!
 **Make a goal jar**: Write down all your goals, all your dreams... and put them in a jar. Every time you achieve one, take it out and throw it in the air! It's like a little miracle, every single time!
 **Celebrate every little thing**: Don't just wait for the big stuff, celebrate every little thing! Every tiny win, every little victory... celebrate it all!
 **Make a video**: Record yourself, talk to yourself... tell yourself how proud you are! Tell yourself how far you've come! Tell yourself you're a ROCKSTAR!
 **Get an accountability partner**: Find someone who believes in you, who's got your back... who's gonna push you to be your best self! Find someone who's gonna make you laugh, who's gonna make you cry... who's gonna make you SOAR!
 **Make a progress playlist**: Put all your favorite songs on one playlist... every song that makes you feel like a queen, every song that makes you wanna dance... every song that makes you wanna SING!

Oh my gosh, I'm getting all teary-eyed just thinking about it! Tracking our progress is like... it's like we're giving ourselves permission to be proud of ourselves. To be proud of who we are. To be proud of what we've done. To be proud of what we're gonna do!
